  {panel}

h3. Summary
- Cannot delete pinned comment in an attachment. Check video:  [^pincomment.mp4]

h3. Steps to Replicate
- Attach a file in a page
- Click on the attachment while in view mode
- In the bottom we have the *Drag this pin to add a comment*
- Drag it to the attached file
- Add a comment: "Test"
- Click on the {{. . .}} option in the comment on the right
- Click on Delete

h3. Expected Results
- Comment deleted

h3. Actual Results
- Nothing happens

h3. Side notes
- Resolving the comment is *not* a workaround/solution as it will persist in the attachment and is not deleteable too. You can hide it though.
- It is possible to delete any further comment (feedback) that references the first comment.
fields.summary: Cannot delete pinned comment in an attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43199].
  {panel}

The experience for following a calendar could be improved:

# Go to Calendars
# Attempt to add an existing calendar which does not set a related space
# Confluence will display this error message: “1 of these calendars need a related space. Calendars with a related space are easier to find and use.Find out why, and set related spaces.”

As a normal user, this is really confusing: you unambiguously told Confluence that you wanted to see that calendar but it refuses to display it. Worse, the “Find out why” link doesn't tell you why the calendar cannot be displayed, listing only a bunch of features which many people either do not need or would only know whether they need after being allowed to see the calendar in the first place. Finally, if you don't already know the name of the most appropriate space there's no way to create one or see a list of the existing ones.

As an aside, there's a missing apostrophe in the English text: “Watch – When you watch a space, youre automatically watching its calendars”
fields.summary: Confusing relationship between calendars and spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43181].
  {panel}

Tibbo is a hardware company. As such, we have some unique habits and practices of organizing data. Very often, our production files have thru numbering. For example, our PCB filenames start with a number. Years ago, we had PCB001... and now we are somewhere at PCB300. Numbering PCB files (and many other file types) is a common practice among hardware vendors.

Since files are numbered, it is convenient to keep them all in a single space. For example, we would store all PCB files in the PCB FILES space. Anyone looking to create a new PCB would first check the space, find out what the last number was, and increment this number by one for his next project.

Of course, filenames do not just contain numbers. We also add comments that make it clear what product each file is related to. For example:

PCB100-DS202 (meaning that "DS202" is the name of the related product).

OK, so we have all our PCB files listed in the PCB FILES space... but we also have separate spaces dedicated to each product. "DS202" has its own space. A typical product page has sections for different aspects of this product's design -- PCB files, ECNs (Engineering Change Hotes), CAD files, 2D renders, and so on.

So here is what I want, and this is EASILY achievable in SharePoint, but I can't seem to find a similar feature in Confluence. Can we get a macro or a feature that would allow us to query files in one space and show the results (with filtering) in another space?.

For example, I should be able to create a macro that fetches all files from the PCB FILES space that contain "DS202" in their filename. The marco would then display the list of such files with clickable links (for download).

I feel the ability to create such referential file lists would greatly expand the capabilities of your system. 

Thank you for reading.
fields.summary: Ability to show filtered lists of files from other spaces

Scenario:
* page with tasks is open
* session expired
* user logs in in separate tab
* user tries to complete task.
* Error!

It happens b/c tasks macro relies on atl_token, which expires with session. In order to make it works again, user needs to re-load page with tasks.

Currently, error message looks like this:
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-02 at 5.48.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 

But it's confusing, as users may think that they lost write permissions for the page. Error message needs to be more clear and, in case of atl_token expiration, say that user needs to reload a page to make it work.

h5. Problem
The plugin exports its service package, so the DefaultInlineTaskService is available to other plugins. However, the com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.tasklist.search package which contains the SearchTaskParameters class is not. Since the class is not available, it is not possible to use the method InlineTaskService.searchTasks. 

h5. Suggestion
While there is probably a reason the package is private, my team was wondering if it would be possible to have the SearchTaskParameters class exported in a future version of the plugin?

h3. Summary
Editing a page with a large table leads to unresponsive script warning in Firefox with Windows

h3. Environment
* Firefox 47.0.1
* Windows 7
* Confluence 5.10.1
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Insert a table that has over 200 rows with over 16 columns.
# Save page.
# Edit the page

h3. Expected Results
Page editor should load normally.

h3. Actual Results
Page editor takes over 15 seconds to load and "Warning: Unresponsive script" pop up is seen with options to "Continue, Debug script, Stop script". Page finishes loading after clicking "Continue"
 
h3. Notes
* Tested with Mac OS X with Firefox 42.0 - the editor loads as expected for page with large table.

h3.Workaround
* Use a different browser to edit the page
fields.summary: Editing a page with a large table leads to unresponsive script warning in Firefox with Windows

h3. Problem Definition
As more customers are adapting Letsencrypt for their SSL connections. Confluence does not support Letsencrypt structure.

h3. Suggested Solution
The way [Letsencrypt|https://letsencrypt.org/how-it-works/] is designed, there should be a way the user can enter configuration (dns record...)

h3. Summary
When resuming a draft, the location is not retained and the page will be published under the space homepage.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.144.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page as a child of another page.
# Quit the page so that a draft is saved.
# Resume editing of the draft page.
# Publish the draft.

h3. Expected Results
The page is published as a child of the parent page defined when it was created.

h3. Actual Results
The page is being published to the homepage of the space where the draft was created.

h3.Workaround
Set the location before publishing the draft.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43098].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a space.
# Open the space and open a page there, e.g. space homepage.
# Click on the "..."-button (the action menu) in the upper right corner where you can e.g. export or delete a page.
# Open a popup, e.g. "link to this page"

*Expected result:*
The dropdown closes automatically and the popup background is grayed out.

*Actual result:*
The dropdown is still visible in the background. It only closes if the user clicks into the popup.

*Workaround:*
Click into the popup and the dropdown will close.

*Notes:*
This also affects other dropdowns in the navigation section which could be created by third party addons.
fields.summary: Dropdown list (action menu) in Confluence 5.10 is visible in popup background

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43087].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The configuration of the {{recently-updated-dashboard}} isn't working on the *New Dashboard* that was implemented in Confluence 5.9.

If a customer wants to restrict the content that should be displayed on the dashboard, they will not be allowed to do that. Some customers would like to hide the *Personal Spaces* of the dashboard, but this problem is preventing that.

The below workaround will not work for the new dashboard:

- [How to prevent personal spaces from being shown on the Dashboard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-prevent-personal-spaces-from-being-shown-on-the-dashboard-170493817.html]

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9 or above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Confluence Admin* page.
# Search for the *Layouts* option.
# Edit the *Global Layout*.
# Search for the following tag:
{code}
{recently-updated-dashboard:showProfilePic=true}
{code}
# Replace it for the:
{code}
{recently-updated-dashboard:spaces=<space-key>|showProfilePic=true}
{code}
#* Replace the _<space-key>_ parameter.
# Save and go back to the *Dashboard*

h3. Expected Results
Only the creation/updates of the chosen space will show on the *All Updates* tab.
 !old_dash.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The *All Updates* will show all updates from all spaces, even the *Personal Spaces*.
 !new_dash.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
Use the old dashboard instead of the new one.
fields.summary: recently-updated-dashboard macro settings not working properly in the new dashboard

h3. Problem Definition
Confluence administrators have the ability to remove a space's homepage via the Space Tools, which can cause many problems. One of which is that the new placeholder then does not display page tree in the left sidebar and can cause confusion, and not allowing the Page Tree to load in the New Look for Confluence.

Many other things can happen, involving stack trace errors showing in the GUI, etc.

h3. Suggested Solution

# or when the homepage is attempted to be removed, provide a warning about it.

h3. Problem Definition
If the scheduled, "Clean Temporary Directory" is running during a manual backup job, the scheduled cleaning job will clear out the temp folder, removing the entities.xml file. The Confluence backup processes continue, but no backup is created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set Confluence to not run the Clean Temporary Directory if a backup job is in progress.

h3. Workaround 
Use a cron expression to set the "Clean Temporary Directory" schedule to a date in the future that will not interrupt with your backup job.
# Cog Icon > General Administration > Scheduled Jobs
# *Edit* _Clean Temporary Directory_
# Set the [Cron Expression|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF58/Scheduled+Jobs#ScheduledJobs-cronexpressions] to a time that is after your manual backup
fields.summary: Do not allow scheduled job "Clean Temporary Directory" to run when a backup is in progress

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43040].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Confluence should inherit the same functionalities of JIRA's user manager.
h3. Suggested Solution

There are a few functionalities in Confluence that are different in JIRA such as the way to create users with external directories or even problems regarding the emails that are sent to the created accounts.

Such problems are not present in JIRA:

- [CONF-24993 - Disable password reset when using external read only user directory|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-24993]
- [CONF-43039 - Confluence sends email to reset password link for delegated users while JIRA doesn't|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-43039]

It would be better to implement the UI of Confluence and even copy the same functionalities of JIRA.

h3. Workaround 
No workarounds
fields.summary: Confluence's user manager should be the same of JIRA
Table of Content Macro List Style is mandatory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43033].
  {panel}

*Background of the request*

Currently, Jira issue macro with custom fields using username instead of display name to show the names.

h2. Step to replicate
# Install confluence and jira
# Create user in jira (make sure the username is in numbers. EG: AB1)
# Make confluence use jira for user management
# Create application link between confluence and Jira
# Create a custom field in Jira (change owner=user picker)
# Add Jira issue macro in confluence page (display it with table and add *change owner* field)
fields.summary: Option to show display name instead of user name for custom fields

h3. Summary
Recently updated macro does not include newly attached attachments

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Confleunce Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence
# Add the Recently Updated Macro > Edit the macro so that the Macro Configuration pops up
# In "Include these Content Types Only", add "Attachment" to limit the result to Attachments only.
 !screenshot-1.png! 
# Add attachments into the page
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
# The newly attached attachments is included in the Recently Updated Macro

h3. Actual Results
# The newly attached attachments is *not* included in the Recently Updated Macro
# Only when the attachments is updated (by uploading a new version of the attachment) only then Recently Updated Macro will register the changes
# See screencast attached for more information

h3.Workaround
Update the attachment after uploaded, so that attachment is registered by the macro
fields.summary: Recently Updated Macro does not include newly attached macro

  {panel}

When a page that has both inline and regular comments appears in a recommended updates email, all of the comments (page, inline and replies) will be counted.

Say you had the following:
# 1 comment at the base of a page
# 2 resolved inline comments
# 2 replies to one of the inline comments

That's technically 5 comments - however you cannot see 4 of them straight off the bat, because those comments are inline (and resolved). Should we say that this page in question has one comment, or five? (We currently say 5)
fields.summary: The recommended updates email should not include inline and resolved inline comments, when producing a count of comments

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a new Confluence page
# Insert a table with at least two cells
# Select two or more cells by dragging with the mouse
# Set a background color
# Click on Preview or Save
# The cells will still appear white

This issue does not occur when you tint the cells one by one. It also affects just the last modification before saving. For instance, if you tint two cells in row A and two cells in row B afterwards, only the colors for row B won't be saved.
fields.summary: Table cell background color does not get saved when selecting multiple cells

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-42993].
  {panel}

This is very similar to the suggestion - CONF-2803 - that was already added as a feature.

I would like the ability to select whether an entire section (no matter the column layout) is expandable/collapsible when "Page Layout" section selections are used.

See attached screenshot for placement - could be a checkbox with text "Make Section Expandable?" to enable/disable section behavior.

DISCUSSION:
The page layout section/column feature works really well for keeping the 'Edit View' of a page organized, and for simple PDF export formatting.  However, on long pages with many separate sections, and multiple section column-layout variations there is no way to expand and collapse one entire (say, 2 or 3-column) section itself.

To get the same effect, the Expand macro would need to be added to a 'single-column section', encapsulating multiple Column macros each containing the panels (or content) that would naturally display in separate sections (in the 'Edit' page view).

This becomes important when it would be helpful to collapse (multi-column) sections when viewing a page - but also retain the same visual layout where many team members also are editing content on that page.  The whole Expand, Column, Panel/Content formatting makes the Edit view a mess and difficult for some to easily locate content they need to edit!
fields.summary: Selectbox to allow for expand/collapse of a SECTION when added by "Page Layout"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-42981].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to replicate :
 # Install Confluence 5.10 and JIRA 7.0.9 core (Issue can be replicated with JIRA software 7.0.1 as well)
 # Integrate Confluence with JIRA
 # Create JIRA project named jiratest with the project key JIR
 # Create a JIRA issue in that project
 # Login to Confluence 5.10 and create a new Space
 # In the new Space create a new a page named test jira
 # Insert a JIRA macro for JIR-1 and set to show the following column only in the display options :
 Summary, Created, Updated, Due Date, Reporter, Priority, Status, Resolution
 # Insert another JIRA macro for JIR-1 and set to show the following column only in the display options :
 Issue Type, Created, Updated, Assignee

*Existing behavior* : Both JIRA macro is showing the exact column that is being set by the first JIRA macro created on the page as you can see from the screenshot below :
 !testJiraMacro.jpg|thumbnail!
 You can also see that the second JIRA macro shown have the following columns :
 !testJiraMacro2.jpg|thumbnail!
 *Expected behavior* : Both JIRA macro should show the appropriate columns configured.
h3. Workaround

Click edit on the page then click edit on the JIRA macro that is showing the wrong column. From there insert the JIRA macro back to the page and the issue should be resolved.

*Please note that this issue will occur on existing pages if Confluence is being upgraded from earlier version to Confluence 5.10*

h3. Resolution
Thanks again for your patience everyone. We have now released fixed versions of JIRA Macros to the Marketplace. JIRA Macros version 6.0.12 is compatible with Confluence 5.10.x, and JIRA Macros version 7.1.4 is compatible with Confluence version 6.0.x. 

You can update JIRA Macros by going to Admin > Manage Add ons, and the update will be available for all compatible versions there.

If the update is not listed and you are on Confluence 5.9 or below, you will need to upgrade Confluence to get this fix.

The fixed version will be bundled in Confluence 6.0.2, so no action needs to be taken if you are using 6.0.2 or above.

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence administrator, I would like to have additional sorting options in the Page Tree Macro that allow more flexibility while sorting. Things to consider:

h3. Suggested Solution
Current options are:

bitwise — sort alphabetically, for example: title1, title10, title2.
creation — sort by date of creation.
modified — sort by order of date last modified.
natural — sort in 'natural' alphabetical order, for example: title1, title2, title10.
position — sort by the default Confluence sorting rules. If your pages have been ordered manually, this sort will respect the defined order. Otherwise the pages will be displayed in the 'natural' alphabetical order, such as: title1, title2, title10.

Things to consider: 
# Allow to sort/filter by labels
# Add some filtering options to the macro
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator, I would like to have additional sorting options in the Page Tree Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-42945].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce
# On a given page, add a comment including an image
# Add a second comment with a unrelated image, but with the same filename

h2. Expected behavior
The original comment will reference the original image, while the new comment displays the new image

h2. Actual behavior
Because both images have the same filename, Confluence creates a new version of the original image. As a result, both new and old comments now display the new image, thereby losing the attachment's context.

h2. Additional notes
* This is also true of attachments uploaded via any other mechanism (Page Editor, drag and drop, More Actions > Attachments, etc)
* This behavior is not restricted to images. All attachments will behave this way
* This is common for filenames that are generic, e.g. "logo.png" or "screenshot.jpg"

h2. Propose solutions
* *Proposal 1*: In comments, specifically refer to attachments by their specific version, rather than always the latest version
* *Proposal 2*: Warn the user during upload if an attachment filename already exists on the page. We can additionally offer an option to rename the file or to continue and create a new version of the existing file
fields.summary: When attachments of the same name are uploaded, all page references automatically show latest version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-42924].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have a job that exports a documentation space as PDF. The instance is: https://snpseq.atlassian.net/wiki/

This is major, since we use it to export the documentation in our build/deployment pipeline.

I'm using the SOAP API, in particular the `exportSpace` method, documented [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/deprecated-apis/remote-api-specification-for-pdf-export#RemoteAPISpecificationforPDFExport-SOAPInformation]:

Recently, this started failing regularly with the error: *504, Gateway time-out.*

Details:
* I'm using the SOAP API through a Python library called suds.
* If it helps, the exact code I'm running is available [here|https://github.com/withrocks/confluence-tools/blob/master/confluence_tools/main.py#L85] on my github account.
fields.summary: Getting time-out while exporting a space via the SOAP api
